meanings.definition: The action or process of detaching or being detached.
meanings.sent1: The detachments of the magnets from the fridge were easy to see.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the scientist observed the detachments of the cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The detachments of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her detachment from the situation allowed her to see things more clearly.
meanings.sent5: The detachment of the parachute saved the skydiver's life.

meanings.definition: A group of troops or ships sent away on a separate mission.
meanings.sent1: The detachments of soldiers were well-prepared for their secret mission.
meanings.sent2: The naval detachments set sail at dawn for their classified assignment.
meanings.sent3: The detachments of toy soldiers embarked on a daring adventure across the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The detachment of ships resembled a fleet of silent shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: The detachment of troops moved swiftly through the dense forest, unseen by the enemy.

meanings.definition: A small unit of troops or police officers assigned to a particular duty.
meanings.sent1: The detachments of officers patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The military detachments were on standby for any emergency call.
meanings.sent3: The detachments of police officers were like vigilant guardians of the city.
meanings.sent4: The detachment of troops secured the perimeter with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: The detachment of soldiers moved in perfect unison, a sight to behold.
